title: Digital Green Certificate
description: Proof of vaccination, test results or recovery according to EU eHN, version 1.0, including certificate metadata; According to 1) REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on a framework for the issuance, verification and acceptance of interoperable certificates on vaccination, testing and recovery to facilitate free movement during the COVID-19 pandemic (Digital Green Certificate) - https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A52021PC0130 2) Document "Value Sets for the digital green certificate as stated in the Annex ...", abbr. "VS-2021-04-08" - https://webgate.ec.europa.eu/fpfis/wikis/x/05PuKg

gn.title: Given name
gn.description: The given name(s) of the person addressed in the certificate

fn.title: Family name
fn.description: The family name(s) of the person addressed in the certificate

id.title: Person identifiers
id.description: Identifiers of the vaccinated person, according to the policies applicable in each country

t.title: Identifier type
t.description: The type of identifier (viz. VS-2021-04-08) PPN = Passport NNxxx = national Person Identifier (ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code) CZ = Citizenship card HC = Health Card number etc.

dob.title: Date of birth
dob.description: Mandatory if no Person identifier is provided

vap.title: Vaccine/prophylaxis
vap.description: Generic description of the vaccine/prophylaxis or its component(s), (viz. VS-2021-04-08)

mep.title: Vaccine medicinal product
mep.description: Code of the medicinal product (viz. VS-2021-04-08)

aut.title: Vaccine marketing authorization holder or Vaccine manufacturer
aut.description: Code as defined in EMA SPOR - Organisations Management System (viz. VS-2021-04-08)

seq.title: Dose sequence number
seq.description: Number of dose administered in a cycle

tot.title: Total number of doses
tot.description: Number of expected doses for a complete cycle (specific for a person at the time of administration)

dat.title: Date of vaccination
dat.description: The date of the vaccination event

cou.title: Country
cou.description: Country (member state) of vaccination (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Code)

lot.title: Batch/lot number
lot.description: A distinctive combination of numbers and/or letters which specifically identifies a batch, optional

adm.title: Administering centre
adm.description: Name/code of administering centre or a health authority responsible for the vaccination event, optional

typ.title: Type of test
typ.description: Code of the type of test that was conducted (viz. VS-2021-04-08)

tna.title: Test name
tna.description: Commercial or brand name of the RT-PCR or rapid antigen test (work in progress in VS-2021-04-08)

tma.title: Test manufacturer
tma.description: Manufacturer of the test, optional for NAAT test (work in progress in VS-2021-04-08)

ori.title: Sample origin
ori.description: Origin of sample that was taken (e.g. nasopharyngeal swab, oropharyngeal swab etc.), viz. VS-2021-04-08, optional

dts.title: Date and time sample
dts.description: Date and time when the sample for the test was collected (seconds since epoch)

dtr.title: Date and time test result
dtr.description: Date and time when the test result was produced (seconds since epoch)

res.title: Result of test
res.description: Result of the test according to SNOMED CT (viz. VS-2021-04-08)

fac.title: Testing centre or facility
fac.description: Name/code of testing centre, facility or a health authority responsible for the testing event. (not specified in VS-2021-04-08)

cou.title: Country
cou.description: Country (member state) of test (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Code)

dis.title: Disease
dis.description: Disease or agent the citizen has recovered from

dat.title: Date of first positive test result
dat.description: The date when the sample for the test was collected that led to a positive test result

cou.title: Country of test
cou.description: Country (member state) in which the first positive test was performed (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Code)

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Identifier of the DGC, called UVID (V for vaccinations), will maybe be renamed to DGCI?

vf.title: valid from
vf.description: Certificate valid from (optional for vaccination and testing, viz. annex)

vu.title: valid until
vu.description: Certificate valid until (optional for vaccination and testing, viz. annex)

co.title: Issuing authority country
co.description: Country of the issuing authority (optional for vaccination and testing, viz. annex)

vr.title: Schema version
vr.description: Version of the schema (optional, viz. annex)

ty.title: Schema type
ty.description: Define schema type for easier detection for applicatione (e.g. smartphone wallets). Can also be used to refer to schemas with less data fields e.g. for privacy issues.
